intro: Kutchubaea morilloi, commonly known as the Morillo's kutchubaea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes plants known for their milky sap and often showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers are usually clustered in inflorescences and feature vibrant colors, often in shades of yellow or orange. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
